title: @Meddler Any Kennen nerfs on the horizon?

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Kennen when played Top. Statistics include Kennen's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Kennen Top is Strong or Weak Against.

body:
Statistically speaking, Kennen is probably the strongest Top Laner at the moment.

He retains a 51.39% winrate, while having a 10.87% Playrate, which is only reduced because of his 25.84% ban rate.

Currently, the highest playrate champion Top Lane is {{champion:92}} , but her player bases' average games on Riven is 142.31, compared to only 27.63 for Kennen. 

Riven still only has a Winrate of 50.8%, while having much of her player base in dedicated mains.

Kennen, on the other hand, is beating her even when his player base only has 1/7 the games on him.

You also have to remember that before the popularity spike that was caused by Worlds, Kennen had a 53.3% winrate, although a much lower play rate.

Can you notify us if there are any nerfs coming for him soon?

Edit: I know someone is saying "Going off just Winrates is BS." But please remember that I am also using looking at how many games people have played on the champion, and it turns out people are just abusing Kennen for FreElo.

replies.body: Nothing currently planned. We're working on the pre-season patch right now, which has enough changes to the game in it that it'll disrupt balance across the board for a patch or two. We tend not to do individual champion balance adjustments in the pre-season patch or just before it unless they're really out of line as a result, given they'll shortly get shaken up a bit by the new environment. Kennen's getting some attention at present, I'd assume based off his World's play, he certainly doesn't seem like an urgent problem though, especially given that we've got Protobelt nerfs coming that we'd expect to noticeably impact him as one of its core users. We'll give him another look post pre-season see where he's ended up.
Any nerf planned for Jayce presaison ? he's clearly overhelming toplane (same at world's ). I saw on pbe a futur skin release for Jayce, will u wait after the release for the nerf ?

Same thinking on Jayce, we'll assess him post Pre-Season, especially given a number of items he uses will probably be less appealing to him after the patch (Ghostblade especially is going to be less appealing to ADCs/ADC ish champs).

In terms of skins we don't account for upcoming or recently released skins in the balance process.
Are you not considering the fact that he was directly buffed right before worlds. I think that is the specific reason behind the issue that he is causing game health and balance wise atm.

It doesn't matter why he's good right now, core items of his being nerfed will still make him weaker. Nerfing him individually at the same time as nerfing his core items would likely be huge overkill.

thanks for the reply... 
so he will stay my perma ban^^
Hope Youmuu change will not hit hard my Wukong...

Are Assassin-y ADCs like {{champion:29}} and {{champion:119}} going to still enjoy Ghostblade?

I can't imagine Twitch being well-off without that active.

Over at r/Quinnmains we tend to do a lot of mathematics behind different builds and theorycraft a lot. When pre-season hits, we plan to mathematically compare her damage and other stats/stuff from before pre-season with all the possibilities after preseason. If the end result turns out to be weaker, would that be enough for you guys to give her some form of buff without needing to see her performance stats? (Cos playrate pretty much always stays roughly the same and winrate shouldn't fluctuate by too much since we mostly all know what we're doing with her ingame)

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7rEOjdTg,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2016-10-17T22:38:56.416+0000)
>
> Same thinking on Jayce, we'll assess him post Pre-Season, especially given a number of items he uses will probably be less appealing to him after the patch (Ghostblade especially is going to be less appealing to ADCs/ADC ish champs).
> 
> In terms of skins we don't account for upcoming or recently released skins in the balance process.

I think they're fine but just need their itemization nerfed
I remember Jayce being very underpowered in the last preseason.  And look at him now....
Hey, thanks for making AP Kog'Maw not a messy pile of shit anymore.

So you want to see him below 50% win rate? Seems to me he's in a pretty good spot at 51%.  Also, he just had nerfs a little while back.

Sure he is seeing a lot of play in worlds right now, but he's not always doing that well in those games.

You might as well be calling for rumble nerfs while you're at it.

> [{quoted}](name=Reapstarr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7rEOjdTg,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-10-16T19:58:27.885+0000)
>
> So you want to see him below 50% win rate? Seems to me he's in a pretty good spot at 51%.  Also, he just had nerfs a little while back.
> 
> Sure he is seeing a lot of play in worlds right now, but he's not always doing that well in those games.
> 
> You might as well be calling for rumble nerfs while you're at it.

Huh. That's funny? Your OP.GG shows me that you're a KENNEN MAIN! WOW! WHAT A COINCIDENCE!

Here's the link to it: http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=Reapstarr
thats what happens on this forums lol. you get the mains of the champ yo complain about to defend it. no bias at all.

The point still stands. He's  at 51% win rate. You seem to want him nerfed only because he's being played more.  He's only being played more because he's being seen in worlds. It's not that he's been over buffed.

I won't deny that he has high damage output, but he is easy to counter and will explode if caught out. He is a glass cannon. 

I've played kennen for years and won't stop playing him no matter what riot does. 

Isn't it okay to see a new champ being played and doing kind of alright for himself? Give the poor guy some time in the sun.

> [{quoted}](name=Reapstarr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7rEOjdTg,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-16T22:33:20.757+0000)
>
> The point still stands. He's  at 51% win rate. You seem to want him nerfed only because he's being played more.  He's only being played more because he's being seen in worlds. It's not that he's been over buffed.
> 
> I won't deny that he has high damage output, but he is easy to counter and will explode if caught out. He is a glass cannon. 
> 
> I've played kennen for years and won't stop playing him no matter what riot does. 
> 
> Isn't it okay to see a new champ being played and doing kind of alright for himself? Give the poor guy some time in the sun.

Kennen would be glass cannon if a large portion of his build didn't provide HP, Armor, and Magic Resist. 

Protobelt, Zhonyas hour Glass, Abyssal.      All of which give him CDR.   

Kennen's power is a direct result of the Mid Year Mage update, people are just now catching on because of worlds.    He does need toning down, but so does portobelt and rylais.    It's a multiple tiered problem.

I think his some of his damage needs to be toned back. I am starting to see {{champion:85}} at support mid and top a lot more. Many of them don't do that well and are playing them just because the pros played them. The thing I am noticing though is that even though they may fall behind or die a few times early, their damage output remains extremely high by the end of the game. 

It may be the itemization route and {{item:3152}} may be need to be toned down? I am not sure. 

It just seems like he is a champion with few draw backs for play. He is a lane bully, has great damage scaling, is good at team fighting, and has a pretty good escape.

I will say with all the {{champion:126}} and {{champion:85}} top picks it is getting difficult to play melee carries in that lane. Now we know {{champion:126}} will be indirectly nerfed because the armor pen builds will be changning, but nothing has really been discussed regarding Kennen.

Protobelt is getting nerfed quite a bit as confirmed by Meddler, so I'm certain that Kennen and Rumble will both be impacted by it. 

Kennen has always been a flex pick whether it be from top/mid to even adc or supp. It's just his recent popularity from worlds that has really caused him to gain notice. He's a teamfight monster; however, protobelt only enhanced that a tad too much.
The only drawback I can think of is that he has to waste a lot of energy for his lightning rush but other than that he really isn't that hard

Basically, like they said once portobelt is nerfed he won't need it. 

That item is really strong and it's very good on Kennen. His winate jumped as soon as people started using it.

Otherwise, he is and has been fine.
Is kennen really broken? Or did the protobelt system just give him a boost?

Protobelt is definitely the problem as it deals too much damage on its own. Combine that with Kennen or even Annie or Rumble ults and you get squishies blown right off the map more easily than usual.

It's only now that the pros have shown the power of the combo of Kennen with protobelt that people have realized that he is indeed stronger than intended. Though consider the fact that most of his counters have also been nerfed as well prior to this. As a player with 250 k points on Kennen, his rise to popularity really showed up from the mage update ever since the overpowered status of the protobelt item. Nerf it and Kennen will be balanced.

Kennen's main strengths came from the over powered protobelt if anything as it allowed him to dish out additional damage that was far too strong combined with his ult.

Other than that, Kennen had his W range reduced a couple months ago and has barely changed at all aside from some ult cleanup numbers from the mage update. Most of his competitiors were nerfed and along with the boost of  protobelt's damage, it's no wonder he's so popular at Worlds.  I really think nerfing protobelt will solve the issue - look at Rumble as well who also abuses the item.
I saw a lot of kennen mids when I was going into silver. Same with jayce, they are very annoying to deal with. Range and a ton of damage. They can splitpush, poke, and win teamfights.
